title: Mourning the death of Francis S. Dohnalek, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death  of  Francis  S. Dohnalek,
distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body to pay tribute to the
citizens of the State of New York  whose  lifework  and  civic  endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS,  World  War  II Veteran Francis S. Dohnalek, of Johnson City,
New York, died on June 29, 2010, at the age of 83, after living  a  rich
and noble life; and
  WHEREAS,  Born  March  16,  1927,  in Binghamton, New York, Francis S.
Dohnalek excelled in high school football and track and was a member  of
the  Slovak  Gymnastics  Club; after high school he went on to play semi
professional football; and
  WHEREAS, Francis S. Dohnalek attended St. Bonaventure University where
he was pursuing a career in the priesthood when he bravely chose to join
the United States Marine Corps during World War II and was stationed  in
the Pacific Theater in China; and
  WHEREAS, Becoming a fireman in Johnson City, New York, in 1951 Francis
S.  Dohnalek  held  the rank of Lieutenant, then Captain, and eventually
became Assistant Chief; he retired from the Johnson City Fire Department
after 47 years of loyal service, loving and cherishing his career  as  a
firefighter; and
  WHEREAS,  A  well  decorated  and admired fireman, Francis S. Dohnalek
earned the prestigious Fireman of the Year award on more than one  occa-
sion  and was honored for courageously saving the life of a fellow fire-
man; and
  WHEREAS, Francis S. Dohnalek was the esteemed Grand  Marshall  of  the
Broome  County  Firefighter's Parade; Johnson City fire truck Number Two
was dedicated in his honor, bearing a plaque with his name on it;  after
retirement,  he  enjoyed spending Saturday mornings visiting the Johnson
City Firefighters; and
  WHEREAS, A proud member of many organizations, Francis S. Dohnalek was
affiliated with the American Legion Post 758, the New York State Profes-
sional Firefighters  Association,  the  New  York  State  Fire  Training
Instructors  Association, the IAFF Local 921, the New York State Associ-
ation of Fire Chiefs, and the Broome County  Firefighter's  Association;
and
  WHEREAS,  Generously  giving  of his time volunteering at the Catholic
Charities food pantry, Francis S. Dohnalek was awarded  many  times  for
his  noble efforts as a good Samaritan; he received several certificates
of appreciation from the American Red Cross for his years  of  dedicated
service; and
  WHEREAS,  In addition to receiving a multitude of awards and accolades
throughout his lifetime, The Francis Dohnalek Scholarship Fund,  Johnson
City Parent Teacher Association award for outstanding service to Johnson
City Youth, was created in his name; and
  WHEREAS,  Francis  S. Dohnalek and his wife Julia received the Johnson
City Sertoma Service to Mankind Award  for  their  foster  parent  work;
besides  their  five  natural  children,  this compassionate couple were
foster parents for Catholic Social Services to 123 foster children; and
  WHEREAS, Francis S. Dohnalek enjoyed hunting,  fishing,  and  watching
football, but most of all he enjoyed spending time with his family; and
  WHEREAS,  Francis  S.  Dohnalek  is  survived by his loving wife of 60
years, Julia; his four wonderful children, Sheila, Jean, Joe and  Danny;
his  grandchildren,  Tim, Rebecca, Chrissy, Ben, Jack, Rachel, Abbie and

Olivia; and his great-grandchildren, Brayden, Adyson, Elyssa, and  Hunt-
er; as well as many other foster children, friends and family; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, Francis S. Dohnalek leaves
behind a legacy which will long endure the  passage  of  time  and  will
remain  as  a  comforting  memory  to all he served and befriended; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
mourn  the  death  of  Francis  S.  Dohnalek,  distinguished citizen and
devoted member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Francis S. Dohnalek.
